metadata.title: CVE-2016-2831 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla Firefox before 47.0 and Firefox ESR 45.x before 45.2 do not ensurethat the user approves the fullscreen and pointerlock settings, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (UI outage), orconduct clickjacking or spoofing attacks, via a crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2831` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
